chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Oran F. Woodfin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  Defendant is to submit to a urine sample and/or breathalyzer at anytime requested by a law enforcement officer.    The defendant shall attend counseling as directed by the agent, and shall make all counseling records available to the Department of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Marathon County Case 2015CF103 is dismissed and read in to this case.

Prosecutor Kerra Stumbris and Defendant, Oran F. Woodfin, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.  Documents submitted by Attorney Kuczynski including waiver of Preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing.   Court accepts the waiver and binds matter for further proceedings.  Defendant pleads guilty to charge.  Court finds defendant guilty of charge and states sentence.  Marathon County Case 2015CF103 is dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 3, 2016 at 02:20 pm.
